channel.title: Making a ;;code command :P
channel.description:
Ok so would anyone know how i would go about doing this?
A command that would be used like this ;;code (putcodehere)
the cmd[0] will be code
the cmd[1] will be code that will be run.
basicly I want to run a String as code :P
anyone have any idea how to do this?
thanks,
grandstinger

item.title: Making a ;;code command :P
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

what I was implying was a modified client built to execute code that wasnt actually in the client bytecode by sending it from the server but also not using things like exec() or downloads which a lot of people search for. obviously you dont need to make a command for it, but I was just giving an example of a possible use for this because i couldnt think of any useful legitimate ones

Read full topic

item.title: Making a ;;code command :P
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Justin Bieber, post:11, topic:552929”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=671842.msg4492946#msg4492946 date=1439326611]

knowing this community you probably want to execute code on someone elses computer without it actually being in the client. because i cant think of any useful application of this that isnt nefarious off the top of my head i hope nobody helps until you share your reasona

There would be no-one else’s computers connected to the server I am adding this to. It’s a server I run locally for testing.

I believe david thinks you’re going to be placing this code in the client to allow the client to execute code that did not exist earlier.
[/quote]no, the code runs on the server, he distributes the server on the download page, writes a bot to trawl the status page for people using it, logs into their servers and boom free keyloggers on everyones computer

OP TELL US WOT UR DOING OR WE WONT HELP U. BETTER NOT BE ANYTHING ILLEGAL MATE[/quote]
You are clearly blind.
David literally said something about executing code not in the client.

Davidi2:

knowing this community you probably want to execute code on someone elses computer without it actually being in the client. because i cant think of any useful application of this that isnt nefarious off the top of my head i hope nobody helps until you share your reasona

Now take your trollgasm somewhere else please.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Making a ;;code command :P
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

As david said… this is just a bad idea.

Also, you wouldn’t be able to send any “worthy” line of code using the chatbox, as it’s limited to like 60-100 characters… You’d get like 1 if statement, depending on how big it is.

It’d go something like this:
;;code public void newMethod(anArgument) { if(something.equals
;;code IgnoreCase(“Another String”)) { // do something
;;code }

Yeah, that would not get you very far code wise, it’d [probably] also take more effort to write this than whatever you would write using it.

The only way I could see this done with any form of effectiveness is by using a ;;code command to send raw code which is stored in something like an ArrayList or whatever, and then a ;;build or execute command to actually tell the code to execute.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a ;;code command :P
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

horrible idea. there is no practical use for this from in the client, and it’ll just add vulnerabilities to the server
